intro: Zeuxine moulmeinensis, commonly known as the Moulmein zeuxine, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Ranunculaceae family and is characterized by its delicate, showy flowers that typically bloom in spring. The plant has palmately lobed leaves and produces small, yellowish flowers clustered in racemes. It thrives in moist, shaded environments such as forest floors or along stream banks. Due to its ornamental value and limited distribution, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens.
